button.name: Button
button.description: HTML button tag for your forms.

props.name: label
props.description: The label of the button.

props.name: disabled
props.description: This Boolean attribute indicates that the user cannot interact with the button.

props.name: autofocus
props.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that the button should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form-associated element in a document can have this attribute specified.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the button, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: form
props.description: The form element that the component is associated with (its form owner).

props.name: formaction
props.description: The URI of a program that processes the information submitted by the button. If specified, it overrides the action attribute of the button''s form owner.

props.name: formmethod
props.description: If the button is a submit button, this attribute specifies the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. Possible values are: post and get

props.name: formnovalidate
props.description: If the button is a submit button, this Boolean attribute specifies that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the novalidate attribute of the button's form owner.

props.name: formtarget
props.description: If the button is a submit button, this attribute is a name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. This is a name of, or keyword for, a browsing context (for example, tab, window, or inline frame). If this attribute is specified, it overrides the target attribute of the button's form owner.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of the button. Possible values are: submit, reset, button, menu.

props.name: onclick
props.description: Fires on a mouse click on the element

props.name: ondblclick
props.description: Fires on a mouse double-click on the element

props.name: onmousedown
props.description: Fires when a mouse button is pressed down on an element

props.name: onmousemove
props.description: Fires when the mouse pointer is moving while it is over an element

props.name: onmouseout
props.description: Fires when the mouse pointer moves out of an element

props.name: onmouseover
props.description: Fires when the mouse pointer moves over an element

props.name: oncontextmenu
props.description: Script to be run when a context menu is triggered

props.name: onfocus
props.description: Fires the moment when the element gets focus

props.name: onkeydown
props.description: Fires when a user is pressing a key

props.name: onkeypres
props.description: Fires when a user presses a key

props.name: onkeyup
props.description: Fires when a user releases a key

props.description: The text of the card.

props.description: Javascript code executed when the button is clicked.

file.name: File Input
file.description: A control that lets the user select a file. Use the accept attribute to define the types of files that the control can select.

props.name: value
props.description: The path or the name of the selected file

props.name: accept
props.description: Indicates the types of files that the server accepts. The value must be a comma-separated list of unique content type specifiers.

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the component is disabled, or not

props.name: multiple
props.description: Indicates whether the user is allowed to select more than one file.

props.name: required
props.description: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with a non-empty string value must be selected.

props.name: autofocus

props.description: The form element that the component is associated with (its form owner).

form.name: Form component (<form> tag)
form.description: Used to send form data to a server.

props.name: action
props.description: The URI of a program that processes the form information.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the form (must be unique).

props.name: target
props.description: Indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. Possible values are: _self, _blank, _parent, _top, iframename.

props.name: autocomplete
props.description: Indicates whether input elements can by default have their values automatically completed by the browser.

props.name: novalidate
props.description: Prevent the form to be validated when submitted.

props.name: autocapitalize
props.description: This is a nonstandard attribute used by iOS Safari Mobile which controls whether and how the text value for textual form control descendants should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

props.description: Fires the moment that the element loses focus

select.name: Dropdown list (<select>)
select.description: Let the user select an option among a list of options.

props.name: data
props.description: The options (1 per line).

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the component is disabled, or not

props.name: multiple
props.description: This Boolean attribute indicates that multiple options can be selected in the list. If it is not specified, then only one option can be selected at a time.

props.name: size
props.description: If the control is presented as a scrolled list box, this attribute represents the number of rows in the list that should be visible at one time. Browsers are not required to present a select element as a scrolled list box. The default value is 0.

props.name: required
props.description: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with a non-empty string value must be selected.

props.name: autofocus
props.description: This attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute, which is a Boolean.

unslider.name: Unslider slideshow
unslider.description: Display a series of texts and images.

props.name: slides
props.description: images and texts

type.name: text
type.description: text to display in the slide

props.name: animation
props.description: How should Unslider animate each slide? Right now, there's three different animation types

props.name: autoplay
props.description: Should the slider move by itself or only be triggered manually?

props.name: speed
props.description: How fast (in milliseconds) Unslider should animate between slides.

props.name: delay
props.description: If autoplay is set to true, how many milliseconds should pass between moving the slides?

props.name: index
props.description: If this is set to an integer, 'first' or 'last', it'll set the default slide to that position rather than the first slide.

props.name: nav
props.description: Do you want to generate an automatic clickable navigation for each slide in your slider?

props.name: arrows
props.description: Do you want to add left/right arrows to your slider?

props.name: activeClass
props.description: What class should Unslider set to the active slides and navigation items? Use this if you want to match your CSS.

props.name: onchange
props.description: Fires the moment when the slide changes
